formattedAddress: 267 W 17th St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 267 W 17th St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text:
I would like to give 6 stars.  A true paradise for power yogis.  The studio is neatly designed & thoughtfully furnished.  Infrared heating too.  I have only taken the Seth Barron class - finally!…. been looking for a strong spiritually meditative class after years of basics. His adjustments are amazing too!!
Thankful to find this studio.

text.text:

originalText.text: im all for 'get what you pay for' - ive been here before the pandemic, and its a nice studio.  But im not sure who can afford to go on the regular.  I go to another hot studio now, but looking for something closer to my apartment.  the closest thing they have to a monthly is 20 classes (I do about 25 am month) and its $600 !! Over double what I am paying now.   It's too much - it's nice, but I think not so realistic for most people who earn a living in nyc. Im only reviewing the price - the studio and classes are fine.

originalText.text: If you are seeking a heated vinyasa yoga studio, and some, this is THE place for you. Bethany leads a great team here and the studio is stunning. It serves a great group, a great location, and you really get that heated, yoga, meditative experience. TRY IT OUT! It is something I wish I lived closer to, but for now, I visit when I can!

originalText.text: To know about this studio you need to take a class with Bethany , Sarah , Sussie and Rachel. ( I’’m sure other instructors are good I haven’t  taken their class yet )They are just amazing. I have been doing yoga at this studio for 2 weeks now and my practice has gotten stronger. I’m so thankful I found them. Respect for these wonderful ladies who teach with so much passion and love .

originalText.text: Professional Coach. especially Coach Zack Thompson really understand each breath connection with each pose. also the assistant gently check our pose whether correct or not.
